TopicTitle: Tourists are the pioneers of Kerbal society

Articles.Content:
The driving force behind space exploration is none other than tourists.

Okay, seriously now, does anyone else think that some of the tourism contracts are a bit... overkill? I haven't even pulled off a manned Mun return yet, and tourists are asking for Minmus landings and Duna flybys... Calm down, guys.

> 
> The driving force behind space exploration is none other than tourists.
> Okay, seriously now, does anyone else think that some of the tourism contracts are a bit... overkill? I haven't even pulled off a manned Mun return yet, and tourists are asking for Minmus landings and Duna flybys... Calm down, guys.

If you had the money, wouldn't you be signing up for a trip to the ISS right now? And consider all the people who applied for that silly Mars 100 thing. We've never sent anyone farther than the Mun ... um, Moon. But there are still people applying to go on a 1-way trip to Mars.
Pioneers, indeed. I keep having ones showing up and demanding a "sub-orbitial flight on the sun." ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif)

I almost had a riot on Mun when I told the tourists they couldn't go for a walk when we got there. Had to ventilate their can a bit to let them cool off.

Almost left them there... Want to take a walk? How about a walk back to Kerbal!

The price seems a little low, though. I'm seeing one tourist offering about 100,000 spacebucks to take him along on a Mun landing. I'm not sure if I could get him to the Mun that cheap... I'm thinking the best way to handle tourists is to take them (several at a time, if possible) along on missions I'm planning to run anyway.

I was kinda disappointed when I first discovered that tourists weren't allowed outside the ship ("Please keep arms and legs inside the spacecraft at all times") and that they're wearing flight suits instead of Hawaiian shirts and flip-flops in IVA.

> 
> The price seems a little low, though. I'm seeing one tourist offering about 100,000 spacebucks to take him along on a Mun landing. I'm not sure if I could get him to the Mun that cheap... I'm thinking the best way to handle tourists is to take them (several at a time, if possible) along on missions I'm planning to run anyway.
> I was kinda disappointed when I first discovered that tourists weren't allowed outside the ship ("Please keep arms and legs inside the spacecraft at all times") and that they're wearing flight suits instead of Hawaiian shirts and flip-flops in IVA.

I've designed a ship that takes 4 tourists at a time, while in the Kerbin system. I've gone to the Mun (orbit), Minmus (landing - just to science) and home again. This ship also doubles as a rescue ship - rescue 4 Kerbals per trip. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Later on can tourists eventually get to EVA? I get that they cant do anything without a real pilot or probe core but to lug someone to another body just to look out the window... I mean, I wouldn't turn down the offer, but I would want to step outside if I could, were I in their position.

In my career game the main driving force is the incompetent rival space agency that keeps stranding their astronauts. At one moment I had four poor fellas in LKO waiting for deliverance.

I took on the job, whisked up a quick rescue craft, and then even got offered the rendez vous contract. Got all five contracts done in a single launch, bringing in almost a megafund of spendy stuff.

Tourist are still too stingy for my taste. Their offers for LKO are still not worth my time and risk, and seats on Mun ships are still reserved for training the astronauts.

It's getting annoying actually. I got my LKO full of their capsules and I keep getting more of those contracts. I feel bad for not doing them, but honestly, that got old pretty quick.

Pioneers sounds like an awesome idea. With orbital space stations and off-Kerbin bases gaining more importance, I would love to see contracts to take..well..homesteaders to places like the Mun, Duna, Ike, and so on. There could be follow-up contracts to ferry supplies even. If at just its simplest, like just having to bring a habitat module to drop off at the site.

It would give a new angle of career for those who might have filled up their science quickly, and would like a new challenge.

> 
> It's getting annoying actually. I got my LKO full of their capsules and I keep getting more of those contracts. I feel bad for not doing them, but honestly, that got old pretty quick.

Something that might bring the fun back for a while, is if you have a surplus of funds and reputation, you can come up with new directions to send the stranded kerbals. Why not upgrade them from stranded to marooned, and put them to work at a mining base?

> 
> My tourists want me to put them in a suborbital trajectory on the sun, they must be insane.

A suborbital trajectory only means you aim at the sun, not that you actually get there. It's still going to need a ton of fuel, but you should be able to slow your orbit to the point where it intersects the sun, then speed up again once it registers.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-04T08:22:52Z" title="05/04/2015 08:22  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 4, 2015</time> by samstarman5**

> 
> My tourists want me to put them in a suborbital trajectory on the sun, they must be insane.

That could be done. You would just have to use solar panels as returning vehicle. Sand tourist in the lander and capture them with solar panels as they return as flashes of light ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> That could be done. You would just have to use solar panels as returning vehicle. Sand tourist in the lander and capture them with solar panels as they return as flashes of light ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

As kerbals do not seem to have mastered quantum teleportation, I have a feeling that wouldn't work.

> 
> I'm, going to have to upgrade the astronaut complex to lvl 3 real soon, and I haven't hired anyone yet, haven't even landed on Mun (though a mission is on the way).

You don't even need to upgrade. The limit only counts if you want to hire someone. If you rescue them, you get them on your roster regardless of the limit. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

For tourists, several at a time is definitely more efficient. I have a reusable shuttle that takes a pilot and four tourists up to a transfer station. Anyone who only wanted Kerbin (sub-)orbit goes right back down, the rest accumulate until I have enough going to the same place to send a much more efficient space-only shuttle.

Setting up the infrastructure for a tourism empire is actually rather fun!

> 
> Later on can tourists eventually get to EVA? I get that they cant do anything without a real pilot or probe core but to lug someone to another body just to look out the window... I mean, I wouldn't turn down the offer, but I would want to step outside if I could, were I in their position.

At the very least they should be able to get out of a landed craft. It must suck that they can go all the way to the Mun and not get to walk on it.

This ship also doubles as a rescue ship - rescue 4 Kerbals per trip. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

 It's not so bad. My 2-person Mun lander costs in the range of 40K. Version 1.0 really pushed me in the Mun lander category: my cheapest lander was 20K or so. In previous versions, I had spent clsoe to 50K.
